The only further concern of [Hamlin]93-hamlin was to make sure that [Anne Brown]91-anne was really all that [she]91-anne seemed to [him]93-hamlin to be ; and [Hamlin]93-hamlin looked forward as to a kind of preliminary romance to the strange inspection , this minute examination of a creature who should never guess the extraordinary metamorphosis which might , or might not , be in store for [her]91-anne .

CHAPTER II .

A WEEK later [Hamlin]93-hamlin was painting [Anne Brown]91-anne in [a studio which [he]93-hamlin had hired for three months]874-a studio which he had hired for three months . [She]91-anne had manifested some pleasure when , unexpectedly , [Mrs Perry]94-perry had told [her]91-anne of [his]93-hamlin return , and of [his]93-hamlin desire to have [her]91-anne once more for [a model]875-a model ; but the manifestation thereof was so calm , or rather so mingled with [her]91-anne usual haughty indifference , that [[her]91-anne romantic and passionate mistress]876-her romantic and passionate mistress had forthwith made up [her]876-her romantic and passionate mistress mind that [Anne Brown]91-anne was a mere soulless body , and communicated that fact to [[her]876-her romantic and passionate mistress husband]454-her husband .

" [I]876-her romantic and passionate mistress don t see why [Annie]91-anne should be particularly delighted at the prospect of sitting for two hours , twice a?week , with [her]91-anne head raised and [her]91-anne throat outstretched , in [a beastly cold[876-her romantic and passionate mistress]

studio]2031-a beastly cold studio , " answered [Perry]94-perry , affecting , as [he]93-hamlin frequently did , from a curious kind of coyness , not to understand [[his]93-hamlin wife]459-his wife s underlying meaning .[876-her romantic and passionate mistress]

" [She]91-anne is a mere soulless body , "[94-perry] repeated [Mrs Perry]94-perry " as indifferent to [Hamlin]93-hamlin as [a handsome cow]2033-a handsome cow would be . "[94-perry] " Do [you]94-perry expect [her]91-anne to throw [herself]91-anne into [Hamlin]93-hamlin s arms ? "[94-perry] cried [Perry]94-perry , angrily . " [I]94-perry expect [her]91-anne , "[94-perry] answered [Mrs Perry]94-perry , with a kind of haughty mystery and sadness , " to be [a woman]317-a woman . "[94-perry] " And [I]94-perry expect [you]94-perry to attend to [her]91-anne remaining what [she]91-anne is [an honest girl]2035-an honest girl , "[94-perry] retorted [Perry]94-perry . " [Melton]94-perry ! "[459-his wife] said [[his]878-he wife]459-his wife solemnly ; and immediately [poor Perry]94-perry s principles drooped like a furled sail .

[Melton Perry]94-perry had always an uncomfortable feeling of responsibility regarding [Anne Brown]91-anne ; a sort of sense that , as poor old [Miss Curzon]120-miss curzon had been grievously mistaken in intrusting [a girl like [Anne Brown]91-anne]880-a girl like anne brown to [a lady so mystical

and romantic as [[his]878-he wife]459-his wife]881-a lady so mystical and romantic as his wife , [he]878-he , on [his]878-he part , [hardened sinner]883-hardened sinner , social wreck as [he]878-he doubtless was , was in duty bound to make up for [the good old woman]884-the good old woman s want of discernment . If it had been any one except [Hamlin]93-hamlin , [he]878-he repeated to [himself]878-he , [he]878-he would never have permitted a single sitting ; but [Hamlin]93-hamlin was [a Sir Galahad]885-a sir galahad at least with regard to [servant girls]886-servant girls and suchlike who had always struck [Perry]94-perry dumb with wonder ; and in this instance in particular , [Hamlin]93-hamlin seemed really to consider [Anne Brown]91-anne much in the light of a picture by [an old master]887-an old master . Yet even thus , it had taken [him]93-hamlin by surprise , and relieved [his]93-hamlin mind of a heavy weight , when , the day before the first sitting in [the studio]540-the studio , [Ham in]98-ham had asked [Mrs Perry]94-perry to tell [him]98-ham of [some elderly woman some former housekeeper or nurse in [an English family]890-an english family who could come to [[his]98-ham studio]891-his studio and keep it in order two or three times a?week]889-some elderly woman some former housekeeper or nurse in an english family who could come to his studio and keep it in order two or three times a?week .

" [I]94-perry can recommend [you]98-ham [a most delightful young laundress]2036-a most delightful young laundress , "[94-perry] exclaimed [Mrs Perry]94-perry with fervour " quite [a Palma Vecchio]2037-a palma vecchio . "[94-perry]

" Thank [you]94-perry , "[93-hamlin] answered [Hamlin]93-hamlin , drily ; " [I]93-hamlin particularly want [an elderly woman who can take charge of [my]93-hamlin things , and who can be there when [I]93-hamlin mean , who can take [Miss Brown]91-anne s bonnet and shawl when [she]91-anne comes to sit to [me]93-hamlin]2038-an elderly woman who can take charge of my things , and who can be there when i mean , who can take miss brown s bonnet and shawl when she comes to sit to me . "[93-hamlin] [Mrs Perry]94-perry confessed to no knowledge of [such a person]892-such a person , but sat down to write to [the German deaconesses]893-the german deaconesses , " [such real saints]2039-such real saints , "[93-hamlin] in quest of the desired piece of elderly respectability . But when [she]94-perry had gone to [her]94-perry writing?table , [Melton Perry]94-perry kicked [Hamlin]93-hamlin s foot under the table , and said in an undertone " [You]93-hamlin are [a damned moral dog]2040-a damned moral dog , certainly , [Wat]152-wat . Thank [you]93-hamlin so much , [old fellow]1878-old fellow . "[94-perry]

So [the old housekeeper]894-the old housekeeper was hired to go three times a?week to [[Hamlin]93-hamlin s studio]895-hamlin s studio , and twice a?week [she]894-the old housekeeper opened [the studio]540-the studio door to [Anne Brown]91-anne , and took [the girl]327-the girl s poke?bonnet and grey shawl in the little anteroom , crammed full of dwarf orange?trees , which opened into the pillared balcony circling round [the topmost floor of [the old palace]899-the old palace]898-the topmost floor of the old palace , and from which

[you]900-you looked into [the lichened court]901-the lichened court , and saw the steel?like sheen of the water in the well . [Hamlin]93-hamlin had determined to embody one of [his]93-hamlin usual mystical fancies in [his]93-hamlin new picture . [His]93-hamlin pictures came to [him]93-hamlin first as poems , and [he]93-hamlin had written a sonnet descriptive of [his]93-hamlin intended work before [he]93-hamlin had painted a stroke of it . It was called [Venus Victrix]153-venus victrix ; and the strangeness , the mysteriousness which gave a charm to [his]93-hamlin beautiful church?window?like pictures , and made [one]368-one forget for a minute the uncertainty of drawing and the weakness of flesh?painting this essential quality of the pictorial riddle depended very much upon the fact that [his]93-hamlin Venus Victrix was entirely unlike any other Venus Victrix which the mind of [man]1975-man could conceive . Instead of [the naked goddess triumphing over the apple of [Paris]26-paris]904-the naked goddess triumphing over the apple of paris , whom such a name would lead [you]900-you to expect , [Hamlin]93-hamlin made a sketch of [a lady in a dress of sad?coloured green and gold brocade]905-a lady in a dress of sad?coloured green and gold brocade , seated in a melancholy landscape of [distant barren peaks]906-distant barren peaks , suffused with the grey and yellow tints

of a late sunset ; behind [her]905-a lady in a dress of sad?coloured green and gold brocade was a bower of sear?coloured palms , knotting their boughs into a kind of canopy for [her]905-a lady in a dress of sad?coloured green and gold brocade head , and in [her]905-a lady in a dress of sad?coloured green and gold brocade hand [she]905-a lady in a dress of sad?coloured green and gold brocade held , dragged despondingly on the ground , a broken palm?branch . The expression of [the goddess of Love]907-the goddess of love , since such [she]905-a lady in a dress of sad?coloured green and gold brocade was , was one of intense melancholy . It was one of those pictures which go to the head with a perfectly unintelligible mystery , and which absolutely preclude all possibility of inquiring into their exact meaning . A picture which might have been one of [Hamlin]93-hamlin s best , only that it was never finished .

For , it must be remembered , the picture , or rather the painting of it , was merely an excuse invented by [Hamlin]93-hamlin for an opportunity of seeing , of examining , the creature whose future was in [his]93-hamlin hands . [He]93-hamlin wished to assure [himself]93-hamlin that [Anne Brown]91-anne was really the [Anne Brown]91-anne of [his]93-hamlin fancy ; and as [he]93-hamlin stared at that strange and beautiful face , it was not in reality with the object of transferring it on to [his]93-hamlin canvas , but to make sure whether it was

really as strange as it seemed to [him]93-hamlin . It was also to gauge whatever mystery there might be hidden in that singular nature . Whether [he]93-hamlin ever did gauge it , it is impossible to tell . There was , [he]93-hamlin felt , something strange there something which corresponded with the magnificent and mysterious outside , a possibility of thought and emotion enclosed like the bud in its case of young leaves a potential passion , good or bad , of some sort . At [Anne Brown]91-anne s actual character it was difficult to get ; or rather , perhaps , there was as yet but little actual character to get at . [He]93-hamlin became more and more persuaded , as [he]93-hamlin sat opposite to [her]91-anne , painting and talking or , interrupting the sitting , playing to [her]91-anne strange songs which [he]93-hamlin had picked up in [his]93-hamlin travels , and fragments of forgotten operas which it was [his]93-hamlin mania to collect that [Anne Brown]91-anne was in reality much younger than [her]91-anne years ; that beneath those solemn features there was [a still immature soul wrapped up in mere conventional ideas of right and wrong]908-a still immature soul wrapped up in mere conventional ideas of right and wrong ,

a few inherited republican formul ? , and a natural pride which had grown , as does any protecting skin , physical or moral , where surroundings are for ever chafing and wearing . A soul , above all , which had never yet sought for an ideal had never loved ; and this knowledge was to [Hamlin]93-hamlin a source of infinite satisfaction .

It was a satisfaction , also , to notice how , little by little , whatever ideals seemed to bud in [Anne Brown]91-anne s mind , were connected with [him]93-hamlin , or at least with the things which [he]93-hamlin presented to [her]91-anne imagination . [Nay]154-nay , with [himself]93-hamlin , as [a person not at all]909-a person not at all , but yet with the books , the music , the pictures about which [he]93-hamlin talked to [her]91-anne . [This studio]910-this studio , so unlike [the bleak and tobacco?reeking workshop of [Melton Perry]94-perry]911-the bleak and tobacco?reeking workshop of melton perry , with [its]910-this studio curious carved furniture , [its]910-this studio Japanese screens , [its]910-this studio bits of brocade and tapestry rubbish which [Hamlin]93-hamlin would have blushed at in [London]3-london , [its]910-this studio shelves of books and chipped majolica and glass , its quantity of flowers , was evidently a sort of earthly paradise to [the

girl]327-the girl . And [the handsome , pale , serious young man , with womanishly regular feature and world?worn look]913-the handsome , pale , serious young man , with womanishly regular feature and world?worn look , who treated [her]91-anne with a sort of protecting deference , who instructed [her]91-anne in what [she]91-anne ought to like and dislike , and at the same time asked with real earnestness for [her]91-anne opinion , was evidently its affable archangel . This [Hamlin]93-hamlin perceived to [his]93-hamlin pleasure ; but , nevertheless , [he]93-hamlin perceived also that all feeling , all ideas , were in [Anne Brown]91-anne vague , immature , or merely potential unless , indeed , [this tragic?looking creature]914-this tragic?looking creature repressed and drowned in the darkness of [her]91-anne consciousness anything more definite and developed .

[They]915-they did not talk very much , for [they]915-they were both of [them]915-they rather taciturn ; but what [they]915-they said acquired therefrom more than doubled importance . And of this talking [Hamlin]93-hamlin did by far the greater share . [Anne Brown]91-anne had indeed little to say [a nursery?maid of nineteen]916-a nursery?maid of nineteen has not much to tell [a fashionable poet?painter of thirty?one]917-a fashionable poet?painter of thirty?one : slight descriptions of places [she]91-anne had been to , [villas]918-villas , or bathing?places , and one or two

excursions from them ; vague reminiscences of [old Miss Curzon]120-miss curzon , of the books which [she]91-anne had made [the girl]327-the girl read , the music [she]91-anne had heard , the anecdotes of [Landor]155-landor and [Rossini]141-rossini and [Malibran]156-malibran which [the old lady]920-the old lady had narrated ; a few allusions , short and passionate , to [[her]920-the old lady father]1966-her father ; a few more , sullen and dreary , to [her]920-the old lady own future life ; that was all that poor [Anne Brown]91-anne could say .

For when [he]93-hamlin told [her]91-anne the plots of novels , and repeated scraps of poems to [her]91-anne , [she]91-anne scarcely ventured to give [him]93-hamlin [her]91-anne opinion . [She]91-anne was so earnest that [she]91-anne felt that only something worth saying should be said ; and what things worth saying could [she]91-anne say to [him]93-hamlin ?

" By the way , "[93-hamlin] said [Hamlin]93-hamlin one day , as [she]91-anne stood , tying [her]91-anne bonnet , and looking out over the sea of [shingly roofs]922-shingly roofs , the sudden gaps showing [shady gardens]923-shady gardens far below , open loggias , between whose columns fluttered linen , and irregular rows of windows with herbs in broken ewers on [their]924-their sills " by the way , [you]91-anne have never[93-hamlin]

told [me]0-i how [you]91-anne liked [the Vita Nuova]20-the vita nuova , [Miss Brown]91-anne . " [He]93-hamlin had talked of so many books , making [her]91-anne wonder and sometimes laugh at [his]93-hamlin account of them , but never about that , nor about [his]93-hamlin own .[91-anne]

" It is very beautiful , "[91-anne] [she]91-anne said , still looking out of the window " but do [you]93-hamlin think it is true ? "[91-anne] " Why not ? "[93-hamlin] [he]93-hamlin said .

" [I]91-anne don t know [I]91-anne don t think there are [men like that]2042-men like that ; "[91-anne] then [she]91-anne suddenly added , with a sort of melancholy humorous laugh , which was frequent with [her]91-anne , " [I]91-anne will make [[my]91-anne pupils]2043-my pupils read it when [I]91-anne am [a parlatrice]2044-a parlatrice . [Those ladies]2045-those ladies will tell [me]91-anne [their]2045-those ladies opinion . "[91-anne]

[Hamlin]93-hamlin was looking at [her]91-anne , as [she]91-anne still turned [her]91-anne massive head , with its waves of iron?black hair , away from [him]93-hamlin , towards the light . " Good?bye , "[91-anne] [she]91-anne said , with [her]91-anne hand on the door?latch .

" Stop a minute , "[93-hamlin] said [Hamlin]93-hamlin ; and going

to a book?shelf , [he]93-hamlin got down a little green?bound volume .

" [I]93-hamlin don t know why , "[93-hamlin] [he]93-hamlin said , " but [I]93-hamlin should like [you]91-anne to read these . It is idiotic trash after the Vita Nuova but it is [mine]93-hamlin . "[93-hamlin] " Thank [you]93-hamlin , "[91-anne] [she]91-anne said . " [I]91-anne will bring it [you]93-hamlin back next sitting . [I]91-anne will cover the binding . "[91-anne] " [I]91-anne want [you]93-hamlin to keep it . Won t [you]93-hamlin do [me]91-anne that favour ? "[91-anne] [She]91-anne reddened all over [her]91-anne pale face . " Thank [you]93-hamlin , "[91-anne] [she]91-anne said . " It is very good of [you]93-hamlin . "[91-anne]

CHAPTER III .

IT so happened that as [Anne Brown]91-anne was walking quickly [home]1995-home [she]91-anne was overtaken by [Melton Perry]94-perry .

" What s that book , [Annie]91-anne ? "[926-he] [he]926-he inquired , as [they]927-they walked side by side . " [Mr Hamlin]93-hamlin gave it [me]926-he it s [his]93-hamlin poems . "[926-he] " Let [me]94-perry see . "[94-perry] [Perry]94-perry was more peremptory than usual . [He]926-he turned over the leaves as [they]927-they went along , and then returned it to [her]91-anne . " [You]91-anne may read that , "[926-he] [he]926-he said " it s sad trash , but [you]91-anne may read it . All poetry isn t fit for [women]1795-women to read , "[926-he] [he]926-he added , by way of explanation . The gift of this book somehow disturbed [Perry]94-perry s equanimity .

" What made [him]926-he give [you]94-perry that book ? "[926-he] [he]926-he asked . " [I]926-he don t know , [sir]1717-sir . [We]928-we were talking about the [Vita Nuova]20-the vita nuova . "[926-he] " A lot of confounded medieval twaddle , "[94-perry] cried [Perry]94-perry . " Why don t [you]91-anne read [Lady Audley]157-lady audley s Secret or [The Heir of [Redclyffe]46-redclyffe]2048-the heir of redclyffe ? that s the right sort of thing . "[91-anne] [She]91-anne seemed hurt , and [they]928-we were silent . [Suddenly Perry]94-perry said , with some roughness " [I]94-perry m sorry to inconvenience [Hamlin]93-hamlin , but this will be the last of the sittings . [I]94-perry am going to send [you]93-hamlin to [the sea?side]2049-the sea?side with [the children]1713-the children in a day or two . Little May needs change of air . When [you]93-hamlin return , [Mr Hamlin]93-hamlin will be leaving [Florence]5-florence . "[94-perry] " Yes , [sir]1717-sir , "[91-anne] answered [Anne Brown]91-anne ; and a kind of suppressed spasm passed across [her]91-anne face . [Perry]94-perry saw it . " It s high time , "[929-he] [he]929-he said to [himself]929-he .

[Melton Perry]94-perry could not screw up [his]929-he courage

till [he]929-he and [[his]929-he wife]459-his wife and [Hamlin]93-hamlin had already finished dinner that evening .

" [I]929-he say , [Hamlin]93-hamlin , "[929-he] [he]929-he began , lighting [his]929-he pipe , while [Mrs Perry]94-perry artistically twisted a cigarette in [her]94-perry long brown fingers " d [you]93-hamlin think [you]93-hamlin could finish off that picture with only one more sitting ? [I]94-perry m sure [Mrs Perry]94-perry thinks it is time for [the children]1713-the children to go down to [the sea?side]2049-the sea?side only , of course , [she]94-perry doesn t like disturbing [you]93-hamlin in [your]93-hamlin work . "[94-perry] " Go down to [the sea?side]2049-the sea?side ! "[94-perry] exclaimed [Mrs Perry]94-perry , not at all mollified by [[her]94-perry husband]454-her husband s deference ; " who talks of going to [the seaside]2055-the seaside ? and what has that to do with [his]454-her husband work ? "[94-perry] " [You]93-hamlin forget , [[my]94-perry dear]2056-my dear , that [you]93-hamlin said this morning that May requires change of air and , of course , [Annie]91-anne will be required to take [the children]1713-the children down to [Viareggio]47-viareggio . [I]94-perry am extremely sorry for [you]93-hamlin , [old fellow]1878-old fellow , but [I]94-perry fear [you]93-hamlin must finish that picture at least so far as [Annie]91-anne is concerned by the beginning of next week . "[94-perry]

" [I]93-hamlin see , "[93-hamlin] answered [Hamlin]93-hamlin , briefly . For the first time in [his]93-hamlin life almost , [he]93-hamlin felt angry with

[[his]93-hamlin old friend]275-his old friend ; an unspeakable resentment at this interference with what [he]93-hamlin considered already as [his]93-hamlin .

" [I]94-perry see nothing of the sort , "[94-perry] burst out [Mrs Perry]94-perry ; " [I]94-perry will never , never permit [dear Hamlin]93-hamlin s masterpiece to be spoilt . [I]94-perry would rather take [the children]1713-the children to [the sea?side]2049-the sea?side [myself]94-perry oh yes . [I]94-perry would rather [they]1713-the children did not go at all . [[My]94-perry children]1806-my children are the dearest things [I]94-perry possess , but [I]94-perry have no right selfishly to prefer [their]1806-my children welfare to the completion of such a picture . [I]94-perry should never forgive [myself]94-perry . That unfinished picture , that strange , terrible [Venus]153-venus victrix , would haunt [me]94-perry in [my]94-perry dreams , and [I]94-perry should hear [the whole world]2062-the whole world asking [me]94-perry , What have [you]94-perry done with a thing meant for [our]2063-our joy ? "[94-perry]

" Bosh ! "[94-perry] cried [Perry]94-perry , stretching out [his]933-his legs and puffing at [his]933-his pipe " rubbish ! A fine thing if May gets low fever again : much [you]94-perry ll think of [Hamlin]93-hamlin s masterpiece then . "[94-perry] " May shall not have fever , "[94-perry] answered [Mrs Perry]94-perry , haughtily ; " and [Hamlin]93-hamlin s masterpiece , which [you]94-perry choose to sneer at "[94-perry]

" Oh , please , don t bother about [my]93-hamlin masterpieces ! "[93-hamlin] interposed [Hamlin]93-hamlin . " Shall not be sacrificed . [You]94-perry shall take [the children]1713-the children to [the sea?side]2049-the sea?side , [Melton]94-perry ; and [Annie]91-anne shall continue to give [him]93-hamlin as many sittings as [he]93-hamlin may wish . "[93-hamlin] And then , passing over [[her]94-perry husband]454-her husband s nauseous existence , [she]94-perry began a mellifluous and irrelevant conversation with [Hamlin]93-hamlin across [him]93-hamlin . But after two or three minutes [Perry]94-perry could stand it no longer . " Damn [[your]94-perry sea?side]2066-your sea?side ! "[454-her husband] [he]454-her husband suddenly burst out . " [Melton]94-perry ! "[94-perry] shrieked [Mrs Perry]94-perry , falling back on [her]94-perry chair . " Damn [[your]94-perry sea?side]2066-your sea?side ! "[94-perry] repeated [Perry]94-perry . " Haven t [you]94-perry eyes in [your]94-perry head to understand that [the sea?side]2049-the sea?side has nothing to do with the matter ? [The children]1713-the children no more require to go to [Viareggio]47-viareggio than [I]94-perry require to be made [Khan of [Tartary]49-tartary]2070-khan of tartary . What is required is that [an honest girl]2035-an honest girl , who was intrusted to [us]2072-us by [an old friend]2073-an old friend , should not get to be talked of as a "[94-perry]

" This loathsome coarseness is too much for [me]94-perry . Adieu , [Mr Hamlin]93-hamlin ! "[94-perry] and [Mrs Perry]94-perry flounced out of [the room]319-the room . " [Lord]2074-lord deliver [us]2072-us from [womankind]2075-womankind ! "[94-perry] exclaimed [Perry]94-perry , as the door shut upon [[his]936-his wife]459-his wife , and [he]936-his fell back in [his]936-his chair . " What a nice breakfast [I]93-hamlin shall have to?morrow ! "[93-hamlin] [Hamlin]93-hamlin did not answer , but merely lit another cigarette , and looked into the smouldering fire . " [Hamlin]93-hamlin , [old boy]2076-old boy , "[94-perry] resumed [Perry]94-perry , " don t be down upon [me]94-perry . [I]94-perry really am confoundedly sorry to bother [you]93-hamlin indeed [I]94-perry am ; but [you]93-hamlin see about [this girl]379-this girl "[94-perry] " [I]93-hamlin understand , "[93-hamlin] answered [Hamlin]93-hamlin , shortly ; " don t let s talk about it . "[93-hamlin] " But please don t be in a rage with [me]94-perry , [Watty]124-watty , "[94-perry] cried [Perry]94-perry , appealingly ; " really [I]94-perry don t know what to do . [You]93-hamlin see , it s not as if [she]379-this girl were [an ordinary girl]2078-an ordinary girl or [an ordinary servant]2079-an ordinary servant ; then [I]94-perry should say hang it , please [yourself]93-hamlin ! "[94-perry] " Sweet morals ! "[93-hamlin] sneered [Hamlin]93-hamlin .

" But with [her]379-this girl it s different ; [I]94-perry m sure [you]93-hamlin must recognise that [yourself]93-hamlin . Now [I]94-perry don t mean to say [you]93-hamlin are in the least to blame , or that [the girl]327-the girl cares the least scrap about [you]93-hamlin ; but still , this sort of thing won t do . [I]94-perry know [you]93-hamlin re [the last man]2081-the last man to do a dirty thing indeed [you]93-hamlin re [the only man whom [I]94-perry would have permitted to go on so long]2082-the only man whom i would have permitted to go on so long . But then , quite without meaning anything , all that sitting , and talking , and discussing poetry and [Vita Nuova]20-the vita nuova together without knowing it , it puts ideas into [a girl]1945-a girl s head , makes [her]1945-a girl dissatisfied , that sort of thing , and the result is that [she]1945-a girl goes to the bad . And then , here in [Florence]5-florence especially , [a girl]1945-a girl s none the better looked at for having sat , if even only to [one man]2085-one man . [People]322-people begin to talk at [the villa]543-the villa it was another matter , stories go round , and it becomes difficult for [her]1945-a girl to get a respectable situation . "[94-perry] " [You]94-perry needn t say any more , "[93-hamlin] cried [Hamlin]93-hamlin , with almost feminine impatience . All this gave [him]93-hamlin a sense of moral nausea .

" [You]93-hamlin understand , [old fellow]1878-old fellow , [I]94-perry don t mean[94-perry]

it about [you]93-hamlin in particular , " persisted [Perry]94-perry ; "[94-perry] indeed [you]93-hamlin ve behaved like [Sir Bors]159-sir bors , [Sir Percival]160-sir percival , and [Sir Galahad]161-sir galahad all rolled into one . But it s the fatality of the circumstances , the beastly world about [us]938-us . [You]93-hamlin re not angry , are [you]93-hamlin , with [me]0-i ? "[93-hamlin]

" Not a bit , "[93-hamlin] answered [Hamlin]93-hamlin , quietly , minutely examining one of the pictures on the wall , which was not worth looking at , and had been thoroughly looked at by [him]93-hamlin already ; " not a bit , [[my]93-hamlin dear]2056-my dear [Perry]94-perry . [I]93-hamlin suppose [you]94-perry have no objection to [Miss Brown]91-anne giving [me]93-hamlin one more morning ? "[93-hamlin] " Not the least two , or even three , for the matter of that . [I]93-hamlin was only anxious not to spin out things indefinitely . "[93-hamlin] " One more sitting will be more than enough , "[93-hamlin] answered [Hamlin]93-hamlin . " By the way , before [I]93-hamlin go , [I]93-hamlin want to do a drawing of [little Mildred]111-mildred . "[93-hamlin]

CHAPTER IV .

IT was a cold and drizzling February morning that last sitting which [Anne Brown]91-anne was to give to [Walter Hamlin]93-hamlin . As [the girl]327-the girl slowly mounted [the well?like stairs of [the old tower palace]941-the old tower palace]940-the well?like stairs of the old tower palace , and saw [the distant snow?covered hills]942-the distant snow?covered hills through the dim windows on [the landings]943-the landings , [she]327-the girl thought with sadness that this was the last time [she]327-the girl should toil up to [[Hamlin]93-hamlin s studio]895-hamlin s studio . A lethargy weighed upon [her]327-the girl , making [her]327-the girl feel that everything was dreary and unreal , such as [she]327-the girl had experienced only once or twice before , when one of the few holidays of [her]327-the girl childhood had drawn to a close . The cheerless , colourless , eventless , joyless routine of ordinary life was about to close over , to engulf , [her]327-the girl little island of brightness . [She]327-the girl was longer

than usual taking off [her]327-the girl bonnet and cloak in [the anteroom]945-the anteroom filled with orange?trees , for [she]327-the girl felt as if [she]327-the girl must look at everything well one last time at the bits of brocade and the photographs on the wall , the plaster?casts on the shelf , the scarlet and purple anemones in the cracked china bow , the brass synagogue lamp hanging in the window .

" It is bad weather , "[946-hamlin s old housekeeper] said [[Hamlin]93-hamlin s old housekeeper]946-hamlin s old housekeeper . " Horrible , "[91-anne] answered [Anne]91-anne , looking vacantly through the window at the grey sky and wet roofs . [The old woman]947-the old woman opened the studio door and drew the curtains . [Hamlin]93-hamlin , who was at a table writing , rose and came to meet [[his]93-hamlin model]556-his model . " It is very good of [you]327-the girl to come in such horrible weather , [Miss Brown]91-anne , "[93-hamlin] [he]93-hamlin said . " It is the last sitting [I]327-the girl thought [I]327-the girl ought not to miss it , "[327-the girl] and [she]327-the girl sat down at once in the arm?chair of faded green velvet opposite [[Hamlin]93-hamlin s easel]949-hamlin s easel .

" Won t [you]327-the girl warm [yourself]327-the girl a little ? "[93-hamlin] [he]93-hamlin asked . " No , thank [you]327-the girl ; [I]93-hamlin am not cold . "[93-hamlin] [Hamlin]93-hamlin began to prepare [his]93-hamlin paints . " [You]327-the girl are going to [Viareggio]47-viareggio , [Miss Brown]91-anne , "[93-hamlin] [he]93-hamlin remarked . " Yes ; [I]93-hamlin believe [I]93-hamlin am . "[93-hamlin] " [You]327-the girl will enjoy the change of air . [The sea]2090-the sea [you]327-the girl told [me]93-hamlin [you]327-the girl liked [the sea]2090-the sea one day , "[93-hamlin] and [he]93-hamlin went on squeezing the paints on to [his]93-hamlin palette . " [I]950-she suppose so . "[950-she] [She]950-she said no more .

[Hamlin]93-hamlin was seated before [his]93-hamlin easel , looking now at [his]93-hamlin work and now at [her]950-she , and making minute alterations with a small brush . [They]951-they did not talk much . [He]93-hamlin seemed bent upon [his]93-hamlin work . [He]93-hamlin had told [her]950-she that [she]950-she need not keep [her]950-she head in position , as [he]93-hamlin was merely finishing some unimportant details . [Her]950-she eyes wandered round [the room]319-the room at the books , the sketches on the wall , the rugs under foot . On the chimney?piece was stuck a photograph of [Melton Perry]94-perry . If only [she]950-she might have a

photo ?

graph

photograph

of [Hamlin]93-hamlin ! . . . For less than a second [she]950-she thought [she]950-she might beg for one ; then it seemed to [her]950-she impossible , and the wish beat itself painfully against that cold , dead impossibility , like a bird against its cage?bars .

[Hamlin]93-hamlin called [the old woman]947-the old woman " Take that letter to the post?office at [the Uffizi]50-the uffizi , "[93-hamlin] [he]93-hamlin said , pointing to [his]93-hamlin writing?table , " and mind [you]947-the old woman get it registered . "[93-hamlin] It was the first time that [Hamlin]93-hamlin had sent [the old woman]947-the old woman on an errand during one of [Anne Brown]91-anne s sittings , when [she]950-she was wo nt to go in and out of [the studio]540-the studio noiselessly , like [a watchful duenna]956-a watchful duenna . The heavy stairs door banged behind [her]950-she . [Anne]91-anne listened to it dully , vacantly , as [one]368-one listens to things when deeply preoccupied . For a few minutes [Hamlin]93-hamlin worked on in silence , then suddenly , without looking up , [he]93-hamlin said " Do [you]947-the old woman remember [my]93-hamlin finding [your]947-the old woman Dante in [the vineyard at [the Villa Arnolfini]284-the villa arnolfini]2092-the vineyard at the villa arnolfini , [Miss Brown]91-anne ? "[93-hamlin] " Yes , "[91-anne] [she]91-anne answered .

" And [you]93-hamlin told [me]93-hamlin that [you]93-hamlin wished to fit [yourself]93-hamlin to be [a teacher]1956-a teacher ? "[93-hamlin] " Yes , [I]93-hamlin remember . "[93-hamlin] " Well , "[93-hamlin] went on [Hamlin]93-hamlin , " [I]93-hamlin have been thinking about that ; and [I]93-hamlin think it would be a pity [I]93-hamlin mean [I]93-hamlin hope [you]947-the old woman won t think it horribly rude of [me]93-hamlin to say so [I]93-hamlin think it would be better if [you]947-the old woman went to [school]862-school for a little while [yourself]947-the old woman . "[93-hamlin] [Anne]91-anne stared at this speech , and at the close of it [her]91-anne surprise turned to resentment . " Of course it would be better , "[91-anne] [she]91-anne said , bitterly ; " of course [I]91-anne shall always be very ignorant ; but [I]91-anne have no wish to set up for what [I]91-anne am not . [I]91-anne am not going to teach [people]322-people anything only to correct [their]322-people pronunciation and a few mistakes . [One]368-one does not require to study much for that , and [I]91-anne shall be competent to do it . "[91-anne] In [her]91-anne quiet , subdued way [she]91-anne looked very angry . [Hamlin]93-hamlin rose from [his]93-hamlin easel .

" [You]91-anne misunderstand [me]93-hamlin , "[93-hamlin] [he]93-hamlin said ; " and[93-hamlin]

indeed what [I]0-i have to say is so strange and perhaps so unjustifiable , that [you]91-anne have every right to do so . Listen , " and [he]93-hamlin drew a chair near [hers]91-anne .[91-anne]

" Please do not think [me]91-anne very bold , and forgive the horrid way in which [I]91-anne am forced to put things , when [I]91-anne tell [you]91-anne , [dear Miss Brown]91-anne , that [I]91-anne am very much interested in [you]91-anne , and , indeed will [you]91-anne forgive [a comparative stranger]2098-a comparative stranger saying so ? that [I]91-anne have never felt so much attracted by [any one]1923-any one as [I]91-anne do by [you]91-anne . "[91-anne] [Anne Brown]91-anne did not answer ; [she]91-anne seemed literally petrified by sheer astonishment .

" The time has come when [our]2100-our acquaintance must come to an end , "[93-hamlin] went on [Hamlin]93-hamlin , rapidly ; " but [I]93-hamlin can not let this happen without making an effort to prolong it . [I]93-hamlin have [no brothers]2101-no brothers or [sisters]768-sisters [no one]1744-no one , at least , living with [me]93-hamlin , except [distant relations]2104-distant relations . [I]93-hamlin have never taken much interest in [anybody]1907-anybody . But now [I]93-hamlin want to know would [you]91-anne , instead of [our]2106-our parting company altogether would [you]91-anne let [me]93-hamlin[93-hamlin]

be ?

come

become

[[your]91-anne guardian]958-your guardian for the next few years , and as such , would [you]91-anne let [me]0-i take charge of [your]91-anne education and send [you]91-anne to [school]862-school ? It seems a very ridiculous thing to suggest . But still [you]91-anne must not be angry with [me]0-i for doing so . "[91-anne]

[Anne]91-anne s big onyx eyes had opened wider and wider . [She]91-anne flushed purple in the middle of [his]960-his speech , then turned ashy?white , while [she]91-anne picked convulsively at the fringe of the armchair . Then suddenly a sort of convulsion came across [her]91-anne face , and , as if from sheer unbearable tension of feeling , [she]91-anne burst into tears . [She]91-anne gave way only one second , immediately trying to stop [herself]91-anne , but in vain . [Hamlin]93-hamlin felt that [he]93-hamlin was making a horrible mess of it . [He]93-hamlin came close up to the chair where [the poor girl]961-the poor girl was thrown back , shaken with sobs .

" [Miss Brown]91-anne , "[93-hamlin] [he]93-hamlin cried , taking [her]91-anne hand " [Anne]91-anne oh , don t be unhappy ! [I]93-hamlin did not mean to offend [you]91-anne . Don t [you]91-anne understand [my]93-hamlin meaning ? [I]93-hamlin wish [you]91-anne to be what [you]91-anne have a right to be . [I]93-hamlin wish [you]91-anne to be in[93-hamlin]

such a position that of [all the men in [the world]241-the world]962-all the men in the world [you]964-you may choose [the one who deserves [you]964-you most]965-the one who deserves you most . [Anne]91-anne , [I]0-i love [you]91-anne and [I]0-i hope that perhaps some day [you]91-anne may love [me]0-i ; but [I]0-i want [you]91-anne to be able to love whoever may best deserve [you]964-you , and merely to do [my]0-i best that [you]91-anne should care for [me]0-i . [I]0-i want [you]91-anne to have a future independent of [me]0-i to possess the education and the fortune which shall enable [you]91-anne to marry whomsoever [you]91-anne will , or not to marry at all . Will [you]91-anne let [me]0-i , for the time being , be [[your]91-anne guardian]958-your guardian , [[your]91-anne father]1787-your father , [[your]91-anne brother]968-your brother ; let [me]0-i provide for [you]91-anne , take care of [your]91-anne money , see to [your]91-anne education ? [I]0-i do not ask [you]91-anne to love [me]0-i , but merely to give [me]0-i a chance of trying to make [you]91-anne prefer [me]0-i . "[91-anne]

[Anne]91-anne did not cease sobbing ; and every convulsive heaving of [her]91-anne body made [Hamlin]93-hamlin feel a sort of sickening terror . [He]93-hamlin slid down on [his]93-hamlin knees and kissed [her]91-anne hand . This action seemed suddenly to awaken [her]91-anne . [She]91-anne started up , and making a tremendous effort , stopped [her]91-anne crying .

[He]93-hamlin stood aside while [she]91-anne went to the mirror and looked at [her]91-anne swollen eyes and convulsed face . " May [I]91-anne have a glass of water ? "[91-anne] [she]91-anne asked ; then , stopping [Hamlin]93-hamlin , " never mind , "[91-anne] [she]91-anne said " never mind [I]91-anne must go ; "[91-anne] and [she]91-anne pulled [her]91-anne blue veil hurriedly over [her]91-anne eyes and huddled on [her]91-anne cloak . " [Miss Brown]91-anne , "[93-hamlin] cried [Hamlin]93-hamlin , " why don t [you]91-anne answer [me]93-hamlin ? "[93-hamlin] and [he]93-hamlin laid hold of [her]91-anne arm as [she]91-anne was about to open the door . " Because [you]93-hamlin do not deserve it , "[91-anne] [she]91-anne answered , trying to loosen [his]93-hamlin grasp . " Let [me]91-anne go , please . "[91-anne]

" [I]93-hamlin can not let [you]91-anne go , "[93-hamlin] answered [Hamlin]93-hamlin calmly , standing before the door , " until [you]91-anne have listened to [me]93-hamlin . Will [you]91-anne let [me]93-hamlin provide for [your]91-anne future , send [you]91-anne to [school]862-school , and then place [you]91-anne in the care of [[my]93-hamlin aunt]2108-my aunt ? Will [you]91-anne let [me]93-hamlin act as if [I]93-hamlin were [[your]91-anne guardian]958-your guardian for the next three years , and at the end of [them]2110-them [you]91-anne shall have enough to live and marry as befits [a lady]1783-a lady , and be as free as air , or become [[my]93-hamlin[93-hamlin]

wife]1791-my wife whichever [you]969-you shall choose ? Answer [me]0-i , for [I]0-i am serious . "[93-hamlin]

[Anne Brown]91-anne paused . " Don t ask [me]91-anne for an answer now , "[91-anne] [she]91-anne said ; " [I]91-anne am not sure that [you]93-hamlin are in earnest . "[91-anne] " [I]93-hamlin am indeed [I]93-hamlin am ! "[93-hamlin] cried [Hamlin]93-hamlin ; " [I]93-hamlin have intended asking [you]91-anne this ever since [my]93-hamlin return to [Florence]5-florence . [I]93-hamlin returned merely in order to ask [you]91-anne . [I]93-hamlin am in earnest ; can not [you]93-hamlin give [me]93-hamlin a serious answer ? "[93-hamlin] " Not now [I]93-hamlin can t think about anything ; [I]93-hamlin must ask ; [I]93-hamlin don t know what is right to do . "[93-hamlin] [He]93-hamlin opened the door , and [Anne Brown]91-anne walked out rapidly , through [the anteroom]945-the anteroom and [downstairs]971-downstairs .

[CHAPTER V.]162-chapter v.

FOR a long time [Anne Brown]91-anne remained as it were dazed , as if [she]91-anne had received a blow on the head . When [she]91-anne got back to [the Perrys house]972-the perrys house , [she]91-anne felt broken in all [her]91-anne limbs , and slipped up?stairs and threw [herself]91-anne on [her]91-anne bed . But it was no use : all that day , while attending on [the children]1713-the children and doing [her]91-anne usual work , [she]91-anne felt as if [some one else]974-some one else were doing it all ; while [she]91-anne remained conscious only of something very sudden and strange , of a confused buzzing in [her]91-anne brain , through which [she]91-anne heard the voice of [Hamlin]93-hamlin repeating [his]93-hamlin words in [the studio]540-the studio ; words which somehow made [her]91-anne indignant , angry , and at the same time filled [her]91-anne with a sense of having done something which [she]91-anne should not . This feeling increased

at night , and [she]91-anne lay awake while the clocks struck hour after hour , hot , red , half deafened by [her]91-anne own blood , fevered and vaguely indignant . It was as if [Hamlin]93-hamlin had struck [her]91-anne ; [she]91-anne felt insulted , outraged , by this strange interference with [her]91-anne fate , this wonderful intrusion of excitement into [her]91-anne dull and sombre life . It was dawn when [she]91-anne awoke : a chill greyness in the sky , reddened by the pale winter sun . [She]91-anne knew that something had happened , that something was changed . [She]91-anne was almost surprised to find [herself]91-anne in [[her]91-anne usual room]976-her usual room , with [the children]1713-the children s tea?sets on the chest of drawers , the coloured pictures from the Illustrated and the Graphic pinned on the walls , [the dolls houses in the corner]978-the dolls houses in the corner , and [little May]163-little may asleep by [her]91-anne side in [[her]91-anne crib]979-her crib . Then [she]91-anne remembered it all , and sat up in [her]91-anne bed thinking about it . Things appeared to [her]91-anne in quite a new light . [She]91-anne had been an ungrateful beast to feel as [she]91-anne had towards [Hamlin]93-hamlin ; and a great wave of gratitude and awe , and love and joy , welled up in [her]91-anne heart . It was as if [she]91-anne were sitting

in the sunshine : an indefinable kind of happiness . How noble and generous and good [he]93-hamlin had been ; and how doubly so , being so great , and [she]91-anne being a mere nothing in [the world]241-the world ! Whether [he]93-hamlin loved [her]91-anne or [she]91-anne [him]93-hamlin , [she]91-anne did not ask [herself]91-anne ; it seemed a thing to die of for sheer happiness , that [any one]1923-any one should care for [her]91-anne and [her]91-anne future . And just in proportion to [her]91-anne usual pride , and sullenness , and joylessness , [she]91-anne felt happy in the idea of deserving nothing and receiving everything , from [his]93-hamlin kindness : and [Hamlin]93-hamlin , with whom [she]91-anne had spoken not twenty?four hours earlier , whom [she]91-anne would see again that day , appeared to [her]91-anne as a distant , dim , ineffable creature , lighting and warming [her]91-anne like the sun , but equally unapproachable . But on thinking it over , things came round to commonplace actuality . What was [she]91-anne to do ? Would [he]93-hamlin ask [her]91-anne again ? or even , had [he]93-hamlin asked [her]91-anne at all ? It all seemed a dream , and [she]91-anne did not venture to examine into its reality . [She]91-anne determined to tell it all to [Perry]94-perry , and ask [his]93-hamlin advice ; but [she]91-anne felt as

if [she]91-anne never could . [She]91-anne met [Perry]94-perry several times in the course of the morning , but [she]91-anne could not succeed in screwing up [her]91-anne courage . What if it should all prove to be an illusion ? [She]91-anne took [the children]1713-the children out for [their]1713-the children accustomed walk , during which [she]91-anne was even more silent than usual . On returning [home]1995-home [she]91-anne saw [Hamlin]93-hamlin in [the street]612-the street , close to the door . The blood all rushed up to [her]91-anne head . [Hamlin]93-hamlin saluted [her]91-anne as if nothing had happened , and accompanied [her]91-anne up?stairs . When [they]985-they were at [the landing]986-the landing [he]93-hamlin suddenly turned to [her]91-anne

" Have [you]91-anne thought over [our]985-they conversation in [the studio]540-the studio yesterday , [Miss Brown]91-anne ? "[93-hamlin] [he]93-hamlin asked . " Yes , "[91-anne] answered [Anne]91-anne , inaudibly , as [he]93-hamlin stood with [his]93-hamlin hand on the bell ; " [I]91-anne have . "[91-anne] " Well , then , "[93-hamlin] went on [Hamlin]93-hamlin , " with regard to the plan which [I]93-hamlin submitted to [you]91-anne , what is [your]91-anne answer ? Do [you]91-anne consent or not ? "[93-hamlin] [Anne Brown]91-anne raised [her]91-anne head .

" [I]91-anne consent , "[91-anne] [she]91-anne answered quietly , looking

full at [him]93-hamlin , as if to make sure that [she]91-anne was not talking in a dream . [He]93-hamlin had never seen [her]91-anne so beautiful and majestic before ; and [she]91-anne had a look with dilated eyes , and rapid , oppressed breath like the one which [he]93-hamlin had noticed once when [she]91-anne talked of [[her]91-anne father]1966-her father , and of which [he]93-hamlin had felt at once , " this is what [I]91-anne want . "[91-anne]

" Thank [you]91-anne , "[93-hamlin] [he]93-hamlin answered gravely , and rang the bell . For a moment [they]988-they stood in silence , till the door was opened .

CHAPTER VI .

[HAMLIN]93-hamlin sat for some time in [the dusty attic]989-the dusty attic called [a studio]990-a studio , while [Perry]94-perry cut acrobats and devils out of black paper , and stuck them on the dirty window?panes .

" That s [my]94-perry vocation , "[94-perry] said [Perry]94-perry , " and not painting damned landscape spinach and soapsud seas . Look ! aren t [they]2114-they [jolly old fiends]2115-jolly old fiends ? "[93-hamlin] and [he]93-hamlin held up a group of black clowns , standing on [each other]338-each other s hands and shoulders . " Capital ! "[93-hamlin] answered [Hamlin]93-hamlin . " But look here ; [I]93-hamlin came to tell [you]91-anne something . [I]93-hamlin want the address of [[Miss Brown]91-anne s guardian]2116-miss brown s guardian , [you]91-anne told [me]93-hamlin there was one , because [I]93-hamlin am going to have [Miss Brown]91-anne educated , with a view , if [she]91-anne do not change [her]91-anne mind , to [her]91-anne becoming [[my]93-hamlin wife]1791-my wife . "[93-hamlin] [Perry]94-perry let [his]93-hamlin scissors fall on the floor .

" Damnation ! "[93-hamlin] [he]93-hamlin cried . [Hamlin]93-hamlin picked up the scissors and put them quietly on the table . " So that s it ! "[94-perry] burst out [Perry]94-perry . " While [I]94-perry was bothering [my]94-perry brains with trying to take care of [Anne]91-anne , [you]91-anne were being inveigled by [that cursed hypocritical slut]2118-that cursed hypocritical slut . "[94-perry]

" [I]93-hamlin shall be obliged to [you]94-perry to speak in rather different language , [Perry]94-perry , "[93-hamlin] said [Hamlin]93-hamlin , in a tone of voice and with a manner which [[his]93-hamlin friend]456-his friend was not accustomed to .

"[94-perry]

" Oh , beast ! brute ! seven?times?distilled and most?kickable jackass that [I]94-perry have been , "[94-perry] moaned [Perry]94-perry , " that [I]94-perry should have let this happen to [you]91-anne ! that [I]94-perry should have let [you]91-anne be entrapped under [my]94-perry very nose ! But it mustn t be , [old fellow]1878-old fellow ; [I]94-perry won t stand it . "[94-perry] " [You]94-perry will have to , "[93-hamlin] answered [Hamlin]93-hamlin , contemptuously ; " and so , let s say no more about it . Only one word : [Miss Brown]91-anne has not inveigled [me]94-perry . "[94-perry] [Perry]94-perry gave a sort of moan of disgust . " [No woman]2120-no woman ever does inveigle [a man]248-a man ! "[94-perry]

" [Miss Brown]91-anne has not inveigled [me]94-perry . [I]94-perry conceived the desire of educating [her]91-anne , and giving [myself]94-perry a chance of marrying [her]91-anne if [she]91-anne would have [me]94-perry , long ago , before [I]94-perry returned to [Florence]5-florence . And , as a favour , [I]94-perry beg [you]94-perry will respect [Miss Brown]91-anne so long as [she]91-anne remains in [[your]94-perry house]2122-your house , as [you]94-perry would respect [the woman who is at present [[my]94-perry ward]2124-my ward , and may possibly become [[my]94-perry wife]1791-my wife]2123-the woman who is at present my ward , and may possibly become my wife . "[94-perry] " Ward ! [wife]2126-wife ! fiddlesticks ! "[94-perry] cried [Perry]94-perry . " For God s sake , [[my]94-perry dearest old [Watty]124-watty]2127-my dearest old watty , don t go and do such a damnable thing ! don t be such [an idiot]2128-an idiot as to suppose [you]94-perry must do it . That was [my]94-perry confounded folly : let [myself]94-perry be led on , and then thought it was [my]94-perry own choice , [my]94-perry resolution , all sorts of fine things . [No man]2129-no man ever really wants to tie [himself]2129-no man up ; it s [the woman who does it , and makes [him]2129-no man believe it s [himself]2129-no man]2130-the woman who does it , and makes him believe it s himself . All this is bosh , [mere bosh]2131-mere bosh ; [you]94-perry ll think better of it . "[94-perry]

" [I]94-perry tell [you]94-perry again , [Perry]94-perry , that there is no inveigling about the matter . [I]94-perry made up [my]94-perry mind to this step while [I]94-perry was away from[94-perry]

[Florence]5-florence . Besides , [I]0-i am not going to marry [Miss Brown]91-anne straight off ; [I]0-i am going to give [her]91-anne the education which [such a woman]993-such a woman deserves , to enable [her]91-anne to marry [me]0-i should [she]91-anne care to do so . "[94-perry]

" Education , forsooth ! "[94-perry] groaned [Perry]94-perry ; " [you]94-perry will get [yourself]94-perry married before [you]94-perry have time to say [Jack Robinson]164-jack robinson : and to think that [I]94-perry have brought it all upon [you]94-perry ! to think that [I]94-perry have driven [you]94-perry to do it ! "[94-perry] [Hamlin]93-hamlin could not help smiling at [[his]93-hamlin friend]456-his friend s distress . " Really , [you]94-perry need not feel under any responsibility . [I]93-hamlin alone am responsible in the business [I]93-hamlin and good fortune , which has brought [me]93-hamlin into the presence of [the most marvelIous woman that ever was]2132-the most marvelious woman that ever was "[93-hamlin] " But what do [you]94-perry do it for ? [You]94-perry re not in love with [Annie]91-anne , [I]94-perry do believe , "[94-perry] cried poor [Perry]94-perry .

" [I]93-hamlin do it because [she]995-she is [the most beautiful woman [I]93-hamlin have ever seen]2133-the most beautiful woman i have ever seen , "[93-hamlin] answered [Hamlin]93-hamlin , deliberately ; " and [the woman who , properly[93-hamlin]

educated]2134-the woman who , properly educated , is of all others the one whom [I]0-i should most wish to love because , in short , [I]0-i can not see [her]995-she wasted . "[0-i]

[Perry]94-perry flung [his]996-his arms over [his]996-his head with a gesture of grotesque despair . At that moment the door opened , and [Mrs Perry]94-perry entered [the studio]540-the studio . " What is the matter ? what has happened ? "[94-perry] [she]94-perry asked with a dramatic gesture , and a not less dramatic accent ; and [she]94-perry remained standing on the threshold , raising the door?curtain with much dignity . " [Hamlin]93-hamlin wants to bring up and marry [Anne Brown]91-anne , "[94-perry] yelled [Perry]94-perry . [Mrs Perry]94-perry tottered , let the curtain go , held [her]94-perry hand to [her]94-perry head for a moment . " [Anne Brown]91-anne do [you]93-hamlin hear that ? [He]93-hamlin wants to marry [her]91-anne ! to educate [her]91-anne ! [He]93-hamlin has already proposed ! "[94-perry] repeated [Perry]94-perry . [Mrs Perry]94-perry came forward solemnly , and stretched out [her]94-perry hand to [Hamlin]93-hamlin . " [Dear friend]2135-dear friend , "[94-perry] [she]94-perry said softly , " [my]94-perry heart told [me]94-perry that this would be . "[94-perry]

" [Fudge]165-fudge ! "[94-perry] exclaimed [Perry]94-perry ; " if it did , why [the deuce]2136-the deuce didn t [you]93-hamlin interfere ? "[94-perry] " [My]94-perry heart told [me]94-perry this would be . [I]94-perry congratulate [you]2135-dear friend , [dearest friend]2137-dearest friend , that [you]2135-dear friend have at last found the embodiment of [your]2135-dear friend mysterious dreams of beauty . And [I]94-perry thank [you]2135-dear friend , on [my]94-perry part , for giving [me]94-perry the happiness of seeing [that glorious dethroned goddess reinstated in [her]998-the tall and bony lady rights]2138-that glorious dethroned goddess reinstated in her rights , and also , "[94-perry] and [Mrs Perry]94-perry s long mouth smiled formidable like an alligator s , " for giving [me]94-perry the happiness of witnessing a union of mystic perfection ; "[94-perry] whereupon , to [Hamlin]93-hamlin s horror , [the tall and bony lady]998-the tall and bony lady deposited a damp kiss on [his]93-hamlin forehead . " Oh but thank [you]2135-dear friend so much ! "[93-hamlin] exclaimed [Hamlin]93-hamlin " [I]93-hamlin have not asked [Miss Brown]91-anne to marry [me]93-hamlin ; [I]93-hamlin have only asked [her]91-anne to let [me]93-hamlin educate [her]91-anne . "[93-hamlin] " And that will be [yourself]94-perry [your]94-perry noble , darling self , "[94-perry] beamed [Mrs Perry]94-perry .

" [I]93-hamlin am happy that [you]94-perry approve of [my]93-hamlin decision , "[93-hamlin] said [Hamlin]93-hamlin , quickly ; " and since [you]94-perry[93-hamlin]

do , will [you]94-perry kindly tell [me]0-i the address of [Miss Brown]91-anne s [[Miss Brown]91-anne s guardian]2116-miss brown s guardian ? "[94-perry]

" [Julia]115-julia , [I]94-perry forbid [you]115-julia , "[94-perry] moaned [Perry]94-perry feebly . " [His]454-her husband address "[94-perry] answered [Mrs Perry]94-perry blandly , and taking no notice of [[her]94-perry husband]454-her husband " is [Richard Brown]166-richard brown , care of [Gillespie Brothers]167-gillespie brothers , New Cross . [He]454-her husband is foreman at a cannon?foundry , or a place where [they]167-gillespie brothers make torpedoes . [I]94-perry know it s something murderous and dreadful . "[94-perry] " [Richard Brown]166-richard brown , [Gillespie Brothers]167-gillespie brothers , [New Cross]51-new cross , "[93-hamlin] wrote [Hamlin]93-hamlin in [his]93-hamlin note?book . " Thank [you]94-perry so much ; [I]93-hamlin shall write to [him]454-her husband at once . "[93-hamlin] " Oh , idiotic beast that [I]94-perry was ! "[94-perry] groaned [Perry]94-perry , " to think that it should all be [my]94-perry fault . "[94-perry] " Come into [my]94-perry boudoir , "[94-perry] said [Mrs Perry]94-perry ; " [you]94-perry shall write to [him]454-her husband without a moment s delay . [Denrest Mr Hamlin]168-hamlin , it is so noble , so lovely on [your]94-perry part ; and dear [Anne]91-anne how beautiful [she]91-anne will become ! "[94-perry]

[Perry]94-perry paced up and down [the room]319-the room in violent despair , kicking at all the chairs and easels on [his]93-hamlin way , and hurling a tin of black

paint against the ceiling , whence , having deposited its oozy contents , it slowly descended . After this , feeling that [his]93-hamlin despair was not yet vented , [he]93-hamlin stalked off to [the German beer?cellar]1002-the german beer?cellar , in [the Via Lambertesca]1003-the via lambertesca , and gloomily consumed a bock a proceeding to which [he]93-hamlin invariably resorted whenever [[his]93-hamlin wife]459-his wife had inspired [him]93-hamlin with a more than usually strong wish to drown [himself]93-hamlin .

Suddenly an idea struck [him]93-hamlin , and [he]93-hamlin rushed to [the nearest telegraph?office]1005-the nearest telegraph?office . There [he]93-hamlin spent upwards of an hour , and consumed many pieces of paper in concocting a missive which should , within the compass of twenty words , convey to [Mr Richard Brown]166-richard brown , care of [Gillespie Brothers]167-gillespie brothers , [New Cross]51-new cross , that the proposal being made to [Anne Brown]91-anne by [a certain person]1006-a certain person must be immediately rejected , as its acceptance would bring ruin , dishonour , and misery on [all parties]1007-all parties . " Proposal disastrous snare , "[94-perry] wound up [Perry]94-perry at last in triumph ; and then discovered that , in [his]93-hamlin zeal for [Hamlin]168-hamlin s good ,

[he]93-hamlin had expressed disapprobation to the extent of exactly twenty francs of Italian money .

" Nothing but pipes loathsome , smelly , filthy pipes ; never a cigar for the next two months , "[94-perry] meditated [Perry]94-perry , as [he]93-hamlin paid [his]93-hamlin money and received [the clerk]1008-the clerk s receipt ; " but [a fellow]447-a fellow must save [[his]447-a fellow friend]456-his friend after all . "[94-perry]

CHAPTER VII .

NO arrangements could be come to until [Hamlin]168-hamlin should hear from [[Anne Brown]91-anne s guardian]1009-anne brown s guardian , and this , even by return of post , was impossible under a week . And during that week , [Hamlin]168-hamlin determined to keep away from [the Perrys house]972-the perrys house : the objurgations of [Melton Perry]94-perry , the congratulations of [[his]93-hamlin wife]459-his wife , the very tittering of [the children]1713-the children , all this vulgar prose had best be kept aloof from [his]93-hamlin romance ; besides , [he]93-hamlin was in the ridiculous position that [Anne]91-anne was , and was not [his]93-hamlin ; that [she]91-anne could no longer be considered [the Perrys servant]1013-the perrys servant , and could not yet be considered as [[his]93-hamlin ward]1014-his ward . Accordingly , [he]93-hamlin betook [himself]93-hamlin for three days to [Siena]37-siena , deeming it impossible that any answer could come so soon .

But when [Hamlin]168-hamlin returned to [[his]168-hamlin lodging in [Florence]5-florence]1015-his lodging in florence , on the fourth day after [his]168-hamlin proposal to [Anne Brown]91-anne it seemed to [him]93-hamlin as if [he]168-hamlin had proposed to [her]91-anne months ago , nay , as if [he]93-hamlin had never existed at all before that proposal [he]93-hamlin was told that [a gentleman]418-a gentleman had called that morning , and had left word that [he]168-hamlin would return again later on in the day . " [Some confounded painter or poetaster of]2141-some confounded painter or poetaster of [my]418-a gentleman acquaintance , "[418-a gentleman] thought [Hamlin]168-hamlin , annoyed that [any one]1923-any one should call upon [him]168-hamlin at this point of [his]168-hamlin adventure . A little later a card was brought in to [him]168-hamlin . The name upon it made [him]168-hamlin start [a large shopman]1018-a large shopman s card , on which was printed , " [Richard Brown]166-richard brown , [New Cross]51-new cross . "[168-hamlin] " Ask [him]1020-a tall , burly man , with bushy black hair and beard to come in , "[168-hamlin] cried [Hamlin]168-hamlin . [The visitor]1019-the visitor stalked in : [a tall , burly man , with bushy black hair and beard]1020-a tall , burly man , with bushy black hair and beard . " [An insolent cad]2142-an insolent cad , "[168-hamlin] said [Hamlin]168-hamlin to [himself]168-hamlin . " [Mr Walter Hamlin]93-hamlin ? "[1021-the newcomer] asked [the newcomer]1021-the newcomer , bowing very slightly , and looking down upon [Hamlin]93-hamlin from [his]93-hamlin big , bent shoulders .

" Precisely and [you]1022-this man , [I]93-hamlin believe , are [[Miss Anne Brown]91-anne s cousin]2143-miss anne brown s cousin ? "[93-hamlin] answered [Hamlin]93-hamlin , stiffening at the other s free?and?easy manner . The very look of [this man]1022-this man rubbed [him]93-hamlin the wrong way . " Pray , sit down , "[93-hamlin] [he]93-hamlin added , doing [his]93-hamlin best to be courteous . But [the other]801-the other had already sat down . " [I]166-richard brown have come here , "[166-richard brown] said [Richard Brown]166-richard brown , in a deep , Scotch voice , which made a certain abruptness of manner even more offensive to [[his]166-richard brown host]490-his host , " in consequence of a telegram which [I]93-hamlin received from [[your]490-his host friend]2144-your friend [Mr Melton Perry]99-mr perry . "[93-hamlin] [Hamlin]93-hamlin turned pale with anger . " [Perry]99-mr perry telegraphed behind [my]166-richard brown back , "[166-richard brown] [he]166-richard brown exclaimed " however , [I]166-richard brown had written to [you]490-his host the same day . [I]166-richard brown presume [you]490-his host know the contents of [my]166-richard brown letter ? "[166-richard brown]

" [I]166-richard brown have received no letter from [you]490-his host [I]166-richard brown suppose [I]166-richard brown started before it arrived , "[166-richard brown] answered [Richard Brown]166-richard brown . " [Mr Perry]99-mr perry mentioned no letter from [you]490-his host in [his]99-mr perry telegram , and as [I]166-richard brown understood from it that there were plans afoot which concerned [[my]166-richard brown cousin]2145-my cousin and [ward]2146-ward , [I]166-richard brown[166-richard brown]

thought [I]0-i had best come at once and inquire into them . "[0-i]

[He]166-richard brown stopped a moment , and looked [Hamlin]93-hamlin in the face , as if to find out what sort of man [he]166-richard brown might be . [He]166-richard brown [himself]166-richard brown might be any age between thirty and forty , of the darkest possible Scotch type , sun?burnt like [a bargee , snub of feature , with a huge , overhanging forehead]1025-a bargee , snub of feature , with a huge , overhanging forehead ; [he]166-richard brown was [a man such as [Hamlin]93-hamlin]1026-a man such as hamlin had never dealt with a type which [he]93-hamlin recognised as having seen among [workmen]1027-workmen and [Dissenting preachers]1028-dissenting preachers : ugly , intellectual , contemptuous the incarnation of what , to [the descendants of [Cavaliers]171-cavaliers and [Jamaica planters]1030-jamaica planters]1029-the descendants of cavaliers and jamaica planters , seemed [the aggressive lower classes]1031-the aggressive lower classes . " [I]93-hamlin see , "[93-hamlin] said [Hamlin]93-hamlin , coldly . " [I]93-hamlin am greatly obliged to [you]93-hamlin for the trouble [you]93-hamlin have taken . [Your]93-hamlin presence [here]1733-here will make it much easier for [us]2148-us to settle all necessary matters . "[93-hamlin]

" [Mr Perry]99-mr perry , "[1019-the visitor] went on [the visitor]1019-the visitor , " has given [me]1019-the visitor rather a confused account of the proposal which [I]1019-the visitor understand [you]93-hamlin to have made to [[my]1019-the visitor cousin]2145-my cousin ; and [I]1019-the visitor thought it wiser to see[1019-the visitor]

[you]93-hamlin before speaking to [her]1033-her . [I]0-i must therefore beg [you]93-hamlin to tell [me]0-i whether [Mr Perry]99-mr perry s account of [your]93-hamlin proposal is correct , and also whether [you]93-hamlin are in earnest in making it . "[99-mr perry]

" Had [you]93-hamlin waited for [my]93-hamlin letter , [I]93-hamlin think [you]93-hamlin could have had no further doubts , "[93-hamlin] answered [Hamlin]93-hamlin , with some irritation . " To recapitulate , then . [I]93-hamlin proposed to [Miss Brown]91-anne that [she]91-anne should permit [me]93-hamlin to take charge of [her]91-anne education for the next two years , and , on [her]91-anne becoming of age and deeming [her]91-anne studies complete , to place at [her]91-anne disposal the capital of an income which should enable [her]91-anne to live in a manner corresponding with the education [she]91-anne had received , and to make a suitable marriage . "[93-hamlin] While [Hamlin]93-hamlin was speaking a sneer came over [his]93-hamlin listener s face . " [I]93-hamlin am to understand , therefore , "[93-hamlin] [he]93-hamlin said , " that [I]93-hamlin was misinformed as to this being a proposal of marriage . "[93-hamlin]

" Pardon [me]93-hamlin , "[93-hamlin] corrected [Hamlin]93-hamlin , gently . " [I]93-hamlin told [[your]93-hamlin cousin]2150-your cousin that [I]93-hamlin hoped that perhaps , at the end of those two years , or more , [she]2150-your cousin might[93-hamlin]

feel inclined to accept [me]0-i as [[her]1034-her husband]454-her husband ; but that [my]0-i particular object was that [Miss Brown]91-anne should , on coming of age , find [herself]91-anne in possession of a fortune corresponding to [her]91-anne education , and which should leave [her]91-anne free to contract whatever marriage [she]91-anne pleased , or to continue single . "[166-richard brown]

[Richard Brown]166-richard brown flushed . " In short , "[166-richard brown] [he]166-richard brown said , with a strange irony in [his]166-richard brown voice , " [you]93-hamlin offer to provide [[my]166-richard brown cousin]2145-my cousin with a competence whereon to live , or get married , after [she]2145-my cousin shall have remained for two years in [your]93-hamlin charge . [I]166-richard brown fully appreciate the intention of [your]93-hamlin proposal ; and [I]166-richard brown therefore beg to refuse it . "[166-richard brown] The blood rushed to [Hamlin]93-hamlin s head . That such an interpretation should be put upon [his]166-richard brown words had never entered [his]93-hamlin mind . It was as if a whip had whizzed about [his]93-hamlin ears and cut into [his]93-hamlin face . [His]93-hamlin first impulse was to knock the other down . But the sense of [his]93-hamlin misunderstood superiority , superiority unintelligible to [[his]93-hamlin visitor]1036-his visitor , restrained [him]93-hamlin .

" [I]166-richard brown quite understand [your]93-hamlin refusal , [Mr Brown]166-richard brown , "[166-richard brown] [he]166-richard brown answered , " as a result of [your]93-hamlin interpretation of the case ; and [I]166-richard brown suppose [I]166-richard brown have no right to ask [you]93-hamlin to see [my]166-richard brown proposal , except as [you]93-hamlin would mean it were [you]93-hamlin to make it [yourself]93-hamlin . "[166-richard brown] [Richard Brown]166-richard brown turned pale ; but [he]166-richard brown too mastered [his]166-richard brown feelings . " If [your]93-hamlin intention is to marry [[my]166-richard brown cousin]2145-my cousin , why not marry [her]2145-my cousin at once ? " Because because , "[166-richard brown] [he]166-richard brown hesitated .

" Because , "[166-richard brown] interrupted [Richard Brown]166-richard brown , " [a man in [your]93-hamlin position of life]2153-a man in your position of life can not marry [a girl like [[my]166-richard brown cousin]2145-my cousin before [she]91-anne has been turned into [a lady]1783-a lady]2154-a girl like my cousin before she has been turned into a lady ; and because , even if this be granted , [he]93-hamlin can not bind [himself]93-hamlin to marry [her]91-anne[166-richard brown]

until [he]93-hamlin see whether schooling has succeeded in making [[a lady]1783-a lady of [her]91-anne]1040-a lady of her . "[0-i]

In [this man]1022-this man there was a hatred of [Hamlin]93-hamlin , not merely as [a fine gentleman]1044-a fine gentleman , [an idler]1045-an idler , but as [an ? sthete]1046-an ? sthete ; a hatred not merely of class , but of temperament .

" [You]1041-your misunderstand [my]93-hamlin motives , "[93-hamlin] answered [Hamlin]93-hamlin , losing patience . from [me]0-i . " All this is very noble and chivalric , "[93-hamlin] [he]93-hamlin said , " and [I]93-hamlin doubt not quite natural in [a poet like [you]93-hamlin]2162-a poet like you , [Mr Hamlin]93-hamlin ; but for [us]2163-us [practical people]2164-practical people , [I]93-hamlin fear it won t do . [Hamlin]93-hamlin turned pale with anger . "[303-his guest] The brutal frankness staggered [Brown]166-richard brown ; it was impossible to make any more insinuations now . [His]166-richard brown own imagination , then , was less clean than the intentions of [this womanish fine gentleman]1055-this womanish fine gentleman ? [Hamlin]93-hamlin felt a sort of triumph at this humiliation of [[his]93-hamlin visitor]1036-his visitor . " In that case , "[93-hamlin] [he]93-hamlin said , " [I]93-hamlin think [I]93-hamlin can devise a plan which shall satisfy [you]303-his guest which will relieve [your]303-his guest apprehensiveness . " [I]166-richard brown don t understand [you]93-hamlin , "[166-richard brown] [he]166-richard brown said . " It seems difficult to explain it to [you]93-hamlin , [Mr Brown]166-richard brown , "[93-hamlin] said [Hamlin]93-hamlin ; " still , [I]93-hamlin may repeat it . CHAPTER VIII .

LATER in the afternoon [Richard Brown]166-richard brown called at [the Perrys]113-the little perrys and asked to see [[his]166-richard brown cousin]1062-his cousin . [He]166-richard brown was received with effusiveness by [Mrs Perry]94-perry .

" So [you]93-hamlin have seen [[our]2178-we noble]2179-our noble , darling [Hamlin]93-hamlin , "[94-perry] [she]94-perry cried ; " and [you]93-hamlin have felt [your]93-hamlin heart go out to meet [him]93-hamlin as [we]2178-we have felt [ours]2178-we . "[94-perry] " [I]166-richard brown have seen [Mr Hamlin]93-hamlin , "[166-richard brown] answered [Brown]166-richard brown roughly , not at all appreciating [the lady]1731-the lady s winning manners ; " and [I]166-richard brown should like to speak to [[my]166-richard brown cousin]2145-my cousin , please . "[166-richard brown] " [Anne]91-anne [my]94-perry beautiful [Anne]91-anne "[94-perry] cried [Mrs Perry]94-perry , opening the door of [the next room]1722-the next room . " [Poor child]2181-poor child ! "[94-perry] [she]94-perry added , " how [she]2181-poor child has been trembling in [her]2181-poor child heart all day ! "[94-perry]

[Anne]91-anne entered . [She]91-anne was paler even than

usual , and was more than usually self?possessed . [She]91-anne had seen [[her]91-anne guardian]1065-her guardian for a minute early that morning , and [she]91-anne knew that this visit would seal [her]91-anne fate .

" Good afternoon , [Richard]166-richard brown , "[91-anne] [she]91-anne said briefly . [Brown]166-richard brown looked round at [Mrs Perry]94-perry , waiting for [her]94-perry to withdraw . But such was by no means [her]94-perry intention .

" Don t be unhappy , [darling]2182-darling , "[91-anne] [she]91-anne said to [Anne]91-anne ; " [I]91-anne know how [one woman]2183-one woman always longs for [another woman]2184-another woman in these moments . "[94-perry]

" It is very kind of [you]94-perry , [madam]2186-madam , "[91-anne] said [Brown]91-anne gruffly , " but [I]91-anne think this matter had better be settled solely between [[my]91-anne cousin]2145-my cousin and [myself]91-anne . Would [you]94-perry permit [her]94-perry to take [me]91-anne into [some other room]2188-some other room ? "[91-anne] " Oh , [I]94-perry don t wish to intrude , "[94-perry] sighed [Mrs Perry]94-perry , " [I]94-perry only wished to support [this poor child]2189-this poor child with [my]94-perry presence .
